METS:xmlData.dcterms:title: Slovensko odporništvo med drugo svetovno vojno v evropskih primerjavah
METS:xmlData.dcterms:alternative: Slovenian Resistance Movement during World War II in European Comparisons
METS:xmlData.dcterms:creator: Deželak-Barič, Vida
METS:xmlData.dcterms:abstract: Druga svetovna vojna je potekala kot spopad dveh vojnih koalicij, ki sta se srdito bojevali za dve viziji svetovnega reda ter prerazdelitev moči, in je imela značaj totalnosti. Dimenzijo totalnega značaja vojne je soustvarjal tudi pojav odporniških gibanj, ki so se pojavila kot reakcija na izgubo neodvisnosti držav oziroma narodov, na konkretne ukrepe okupatorjev in perspektivo, ki sta jo okupacija in fašizem nasploh prinašala. Avtorica na primeru izbranih držav obravnava najpomembnejše vidike odporništva kot večplastnega pojava v kompleksnem dogajanju okupirane Evrope in jih primerja s posameznimi vidiki in razsežnostmi odpora slovenskega naroda kot enega manjših v Evropi.

World War II was carried on as a clash between two war coalitions which fought angrily for two visions of world order and for a redistribution of power, and had a character of totality. The war’s character of totality was co-created by the emergence of resistance movements, which arose as a response to the loss of independence of countries or nations, to the concrete measures of occupiers and to the overall prospect that occupation and Fascism brought with them. The author, on the basis of select countries, explores the most important aspects of the resistance movement as a multilayered phenomenon in the complex occurrences of occupied Europe and compares them with individual aspects and dimensions of the resistance of the Slovenian nation as one of the smaller ones in Europe.

METS:xmlData.entity:description: Druga svetovna vojna je potekala kot spopad dveh vojnih koalicij, ki sta se srdito bojevali za dve viziji svetovnega reda ter prerazdelitev moči, in je imela značaj totalnosti. Dimenzijo totalnega značaja vojne je soustvarjal tudi pojav odporniških gibanj, ki so se pojavila kot reakcija na izgubo neodvisnosti držav oziroma narodov, na konkretne ukrepe okupatorjev in perspektivo, ki sta jo okupacija in fašizem nasploh prinašala. Avtorica na primeru izbranih držav obravnava najpomembnejše vidike odporništva kot večplastnega pojava v kompleksnem dogajanju okupirane Evrope in jih primerja s posameznimi vidiki in razsežnostmi odpora slovenskega naroda kot enega manjših v Evropi.

World War II was carried on as a clash between two war coalitions which fought angrily for two visions of world order and for a redistribution of power, and had a character of totality. The war’s character of totality was co-created by the emergence of resistance movements, which arose as a response to the loss of independence of countries or nations, to the concrete measures of occupiers and to the overall prospect that occupation and Fascism brought with them. The author, on the basis of select countries, explores the most important aspects of the resistance movement as a multilayered phenomenon in the complex occurrences of occupied Europe and compares them with individual aspects and dimensions of the resistance of the Slovenian nation as one of the smaller ones in Europe.
